newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end higher, more gains seen.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end higher, more gains seen.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed higher on Thursday on growing pressure of tightening liquidity over payments for T$30 billion in government bonds that were auctioned on Tuesday, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate, rising to 5.625 at one stage, finished at 5.432 percent against Wednesday's 5.426 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.45-5.50 against 5.40-5.45.
The central bank said it injected T$5.58 billion in funds on Thursday to maintain stable liquidity in the banking system.
The bond market reported no trade in the afternoon. The seven-year 83/2 government bond yield was at 5.545 earlier.
